itemDescription: English rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Horace David Jeanes ((1943-12-27)27 December 1943) is an English former rugby union and World Cup winning professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1960s and 1970s. He played club level rugby union (RU) for Keighley RUFC and Wakefield RFC, and representative level rugby union for Yorkshire and rugby league (RL) for Great Britain and Yorkshire, and at club level for Wakefield Trinity (captain) (Heritage № 734), Leeds and Huddersfield, as a prop, number 8 or 10, during the era of contested scrums.

link_mentions.page: List of Leeds Rhinos international players
response: * David Jeanes won caps for Great Britain while at Leeds (World Cup 1972 3-caps, 1-try)
